titleInfo.title: Forrest Monument Minutes Book missing pages

mods.abstract: Missing pages from the minutes book acquired by the contributor over 20 years ago from a Civil War relics dealer in Little Rock, AR. Page 9-10 entry dated August 9, 1898 concerns subscriptions for the monument fund drive. Page 11 entry dated January 15, 1901 mentions a letter from the Hon. Charles Seall of Rosedale, MS who suggested that the association ask prominent citizens in all the counties to help solicit subscriptions for the monument fund drive. Page 12 entry dated May 1, 1901 mentions removal of members for non-attendance and Gen. Gordon gave a report on the progress of the design phase of the monument.

relatedItem.abstract: A collection of all things Memphis... a little bit of this, a little bit of that. The M Files is a great place to find portraits and newspaper clippings, but also so much more. As the clippings from the Memphis Information File are digitized, they will be added to The M Files, but so will the smaller manuscript collections and most of the items used to create the topical digital displays in the Memphis Room.
